name: Shower/Bathe Self
description: The ability to bathe self in shower or tub, including washing, rinsing, & drying, self. Does not include transferring in/out of tub/shower.
exceptions: Not about transferring in/out the tub/shower
Not about washing the entire body outside of a tub or shower
tips: Consider the most usual performance, not the lowest
If there are orders to not get these areas wet & rating cannot be inferred, the rating is 'N. Not Applicable
dependent: Patient may lean forwards, backwards, may be able to hold to grab bars, may be able to raise arms or legs, but Helper does all the effort to wash, rinse & dry patient. The patient contributes no effort to washing, rinsing or drying.
While patient may be able to participate in some aspects of bathing at bedside, this item measures bathing in the shower/tub.
substantial: Patient is able to use a washcloth to initiate some washing, but is unable to reach all body parts
Patient is able to hold showerhead or washcloth to initiate some rinsing, but is unable to completely rinse body
Patient is able to use a towel to initiate or dry some parts of body, but is unable to reach all body parts
Patient is able to participate in some aspects of all three, but Helper provides > 50% of the effort
partial: Patient is able to use washcloth to wash most of body, but is unable to thoroughly/completely wash all body parts
Patient is able to hold showerhead or washcloth to rinse most of body, but is unable to thoroughly or completely rinse all body parts
Patient is able to use a towel to dry most of body, but is unable to thoroughly or completely dry all body parts
Patient is able to completely wash, rinse, dry some parts body in the tub/shower, but is unable to complete them all & helper provides <50% the effort
supervision: Once patient is in shower/tub, helper provides prompting & cueing for sequencing to fully accomplish washing, rinsing & drying self
There may be concerns about safety w/completing task &/or thoroughly washing all body parts which require verbal cues from helper for technique
Touching/Steadying only may be required for balance/safety when reaching for washcloth, faucet or towel to prevent falling, or to enable patient to thoroughly wash, rinse, & dry all body parts.
setup: Once in shower/tub, patient needs helper for initial preparation such as handing patient a prepared washcloth, towel or other equipment or in application of an orthosis/prosthesis
Patient may need helper to draw water or check temperature prior to starting bath.
independent: Once patient is in shower or tub, patient washes, rinses & dries self w/o helper assistance.
Patient can use required equipment, such as bathmitt.
